com.dp16.dynamicrunninginghent.GuiController

Class GuiController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dp16.dynamicrunninginghent.GuiController.GuiController

  • public class GuiController
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton. All communication between different Activities should pass through this class. This way a lose coupling between the Activities is achieved. This in turn allows for hot-swapping activities of a certain type and modifiability in general.

    Normal use
    During the application initialization, the activity-types are linked to Activity classes by calling register(String, Class).
    When a context (or activity) wishes to start another activity, it calls startActivity(Context, String, Map).
    To close an activity exitActivity(Activity) (with 'this' as parameter) should be used instead of Activity.finish().
    Manipulation of the registered activity-types is possible through changeActivity(String, Class) and unregister(String).

    Created by Nick on 5-3-2017.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GuiController getInstance()

      • register

        public void register(java.lang.String type,
                     java.lang.Class activity)
              throws TypeAlreadyExistsException
        Registers an Activity class for a given type.
        Parameters:
        type - Type for which to register an Activity
        activity - Activity Class to register
        Throws:
        TypeAlreadyExistsException - If an Activity is already present for the given type. Use changeActivity(String, Class) in this case.

      • changeActivity

        public void changeActivity(java.lang.String type,
                           java.lang.Class activity)
                    throws NoSuchTypeException
        Changes the activity that corresponds to a certain type.
        Parameters:
        type - Type for which to change the Activity
        activity - New Activity Class to map to the type
        Throws:
        NoSuchTypeException - If there is no existing mapping for the given type. Use register(String, Class) in this case.

      • unregister

        public void unregister(java.lang.String type)
                throws NoSuchTypeException
        Removes the mapping of a certain type.
        Parameters:
        type - Type for which to remove the mapping
        Throws:
        NoSuchTypeException - If there is no existing mapping for the given type.

      • startActivity

        public int startActivity(android.content.Context origin,
                         java.lang.String type,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> extras)
        Starts a new Activity.
        Parameters:
        origin - Context (or Activity) that calls for the start of a new activity ('this' in most cases).
        type - Type of activity to start. This method returns -1 if no activity is registered for the type.
        extras - A RunningMap for Object typed extras you would otherwise pass to an Intent. Use 'null' if no extras are needed. Currently supported Objects are String, Double, Integer, Boolean, Byte, Float, Long, Short and Serializable. Other Objects will throw a ClassCastException.
        Returns:
        0 if the activity was started, -1 is no activity of such type is found

      • exitActivity

        public void exitActivity(android.app.Activity activity)
        Exits an activity. Use this instead of Activity.finish().
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity to exit ('this' in most cases).

      • emptyState

        public void emptyState()
        For testing purposes. Removes all activities for the mapping.
